text.p: Summit Medical Systems Inc said Kevin Green has resigned as president, chief executive and a director of the healthcare data management systems firm.
A search for a new CEO is under way. Meanwhile, company director John Nehra will serve as acting chief executive, Summit said.
Nehra was also named chairman, replacing Hudson Connery, who remains on the board.
Nehra is managing partner of Catalyst Ventures LP and a general partner of New Enterprise Associates, both venture capital limited partnerships.

The company said it has formed an office of the president comprised of several corporate officers who will report to Nehra. "A committee of directors will conduct a CEO search and present its recommendation to the entire board. The committee consists of Nehra and Connery," Summit said.

"Although in recent months the company has experienced significant difficulties, the board is committed to moving forward with a new CEO and the company's executive management team to build on the company's established customer base and technology portfolio," Nehra said.
The company said it will announce its second quarter financial results on August 13.
